page.title: 18Milk and Beef in Langford.
page.content: On this farm in the area the farmer has a herd of 60 fresian cows 50 of which are milking. His herd produces over 800 litres of milk every week.The milk is collected by tanker each day. The milk is taken to Wantage where it is used to make cream and yoghurt in the dairy there. He has about 50 head of cattle which he rears for beef. Early in 1985 an average sized animal would sell for about 500 pounds. The farmer puts the manure from the animals by the side of the fields. This is done so that when the crops have been cut it can be spread over the fields. This helps the crops grow the next year.
